Lyra.Distance: 18.51 ly, 5.67 pc (i.e., distance to its nearest star, 2MASS J18353790+3259545)
Lyra.Notes: Lyra (Latin for "lyre") is a small constellation. Its brightest star is Vega, which is a corner of the Summer Triangle and, with an apparent brightness of 0.03m, is the third brightest star of the northern hemisphere. In Lyra are the objects M56 (a globular cluster), M57 (a.k.a. the "Ring Nebula"), and Kuiper 90 (a red dwarf system, a.k.a. "17 Lyrae C").
